summary: This document contains internal Bureau of Prisons email correspondence regarding the psychological and medical status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 28-29, 2019, while he was held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It details his complaints of numbness, sleep issues, and his pending transfer back to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein's Medical Complaints and Observation
events.description: Epstein complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, and a running toilet in his cell. He is seen by a nurse and remains on psychological observation.

events.title: Planned Return to SHU
events.description: Epstein is informed he will be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) the next day after receiving his CPAP machine for sleep apnea. He requests to stay in the 'safe' hospital area but is denied.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 28-29, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was under psychological observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein reported physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, and attributed memory issues to sleep apnea, for which he was to receive a CPAP machine.
Epstein expressed a desire to remain in the 'safe' hospital/SW area rather than return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), but this request was denied by prison staff.
Prison officials determined there were 'no mental health issues' precluding Epstein's return to the SHU, where he was to be placed in a 'safe situation'.
The document shows internal BOP communication regarding inmate welfare and housing logistics shortly before Epstein's death.
